entries.meaning: (genetics) A clone or descendant of a mutant occurring in a previous clone
(genetics, molecular biology) A partial segment of DNA, cloven from a previously-cloned segment, which is then cloned into another vector

verbs.description: subclone (third-person singular simple present subclones, present participle subcloning, simple past and past participle subcloned)

entries.meaning: (genetics) To reclone part of a previously-cloned DNA segment into a new vector
